meanings.definition: To experience a slight prickling or stinging sensation
meanings.sent1: After sitting for a long time, my legs started to tingle.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind made my skin tingle.
meanings.sent3: The ticklish feather made me tingle all over.
meanings.sent4: The news of her success made her heart tingle with joy.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation of the surprise gift made her whole body tingle with excitement.

meanings.definition: A slight prickling or stinging sensation
meanings.sent1: The tingle in my fingers woke me up from sleep.
meanings.sent2: The icy water caused a tingle on my skin.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment gave her a pleasant tingle.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh bread brought a tingle to his nose.
meanings.sent5: The first bite of the spicy food sent a tingle through her mouth.

meanings.sent1: The minty toothpaste can tingle your taste buds.
meanings.sent2: The massage chair can tingle your back in a relaxing way.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's lick can tingle your skin.
meanings.sent4: The exciting news can tingle your whole body with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The surprise fireworks display can tingle your senses with wonder.
